intro: Hibbertia oubatchensis, commonly known as the Oubatchensis Sunshineflower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with red centers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Hibbertia oubatchensis is a perennial shrub that produces small, oval-shaped fruits following flowering.
